item.title: 美联储降息半点初步提振金属走势不一
item.description: 铜价接近三周来的最高收盘价，其他金属则涨跌不一，因为投资者正在消化美联储通过降息半点来捍卫美国经济增长和劳动力市场的举措。【原文：Copper traded near its highest close in three weeks and other metals were mixed as investors digested the Federal Reserve’s bid to defend US growth and the labor market with a half-point rate-cut.】

item.title: 美元在英国央行和日本央行利率决议前的 "关键窗口期 "上涨
item.description: 美元在美联储超大规模降息后上涨，交易员们正在等待英国和日本央行在未来 24 小时内做出决定，以评估它们对市场的综合影响。【原文：The dollar rose in the aftermath of the Federal Reserve’s supersized rate cut, with traders waiting for decisions from the UK and Japanese central banks over the next 24 hours to assess their combined impact on markets.】

item.title: 美联储减息后外资流入将增加
item.description: 在交易日开始之前，我们为您带来可能影响市场的重要新闻和事件摘要。今天我们关注【原文：Before the trading day starts we bring you a digest of the key news and events that are likely to move markets. Today we look at:】

item.title: 日本央行会议将考验对日元敏感的日本股市的命运
item.description: 押注日本股市进一步回升的交易员们正在关注日本央行的任何指示，这些指示可能会限制日元的涨幅并支持出口商。【原文：Traders betting on further recovery in Japanese equities are looking to any steer from the Bank of Japan that may cap the yen’s gains and support exporters.】

item.title: 交易员关注日美收益率利差，日元跌幅扩大至 1
item.description: 日元兑美元跌幅扩大至 1%，因为交易员们权衡了日本和美国之间的收益率差异前景。【原文：The yen extended its drop to 1% against the dollar as traders weighed the outlook for yield differentials between Japan and the US.】

item.title: NTPC 可再生能源部门申请 12 亿美元印度首次公开募股
item.description: 印度国营电力生产商 NTPC Ltd. 旗下的可再生能源部门正寻求在首次公开募股中筹集高达 1,000 亿卢比（约合 12 亿美元）的资金，这进一步推动了印度的上市热潮。【原文：The renewable-energy arm of India’s state-run power producer NTPC Ltd. is seeking to raise up to 100 billion rupees ($1.2 billion) in its initial public offering, furthering the frenzy for listings in the country.】

item.title: 摩根士丹利双双下调评级，SK 海力士股价暴跌
item.description: 在摩根士丹利（Morgan Stanley）以定价能力下降为由将这家韩国内存芯片制造商的评级下调两级后，SK 海力士公司股价暴跌，领跌同行。【原文：Shares of SK Hynix Inc. plunged, leading peers lower, after Morgan Stanley cut its rating on the Korean memory chipmaker two notches citing its fading pricing power.】

item.title: 交易员解读美联储减息政策，比特币随美国股市期货攀升
item.description: 随着美联储大幅降息波及整个市场，比特币创下三周以来的新高，美国股票期货也随之跳涨。【原文：Bitcoin hit a three-week high alongside a jump in US equity futures as an outsized Federal Reserve interest-rate cut rippled across markets.】

item.title: NAB 首席财务官称，澳大利亚贷款机构将争夺商业银行客户
item.description: 继抵押贷款之后，商业银行似乎将成为澳大利亚的下一个战场。据澳大利亚在这一领域最大的贷款机构称，雇佣员工来支持业务增长将是一个问题。【原文：Business banking looks set to be the next battleground in Australia after mortgage lending. Hiring people to support the growth will be a problem, according to the country’s biggest lender in this area.】

item.title: 华平投资的 PDG 在亚洲各地购买土地以满足人工智能需求
item.description: 数据中心运营商普林斯顿数字集团（Princeton Digital Group）在印度、马来西亚和印度尼西亚购买了土地，并确保了这些地点的电力供应，从而将其容量提高了近 50%，以寻求利用人工智能服务需求的增长。【原文：Data center operator Princeton Digital Group bought land in India, Malaysia and Indonesia and secured power supply for the sites to boost its capacity by nearly 50%, seeking to capitalize on rising demand for artificial intelligence services.】

item.title: 任天堂起诉 Palworld 制造商 Pocketpair 侵犯专利权
item.description: 任天堂公司对东京的热门游戏《Palworld》制造商 Pocketpair Inc.【原文：Nintendo Co. filed a patent infringement lawsuit against Tokyo-based Pocketpair Inc., the maker of hit game Palworld, seeking an injunction and compensation for damages.】

item.title: 中国失败的美国游说策略使科技公司面临风险
item.description: 美国立法者正在向中国发出信号：在可预见的未来，无论 11 月大选后由谁控制华盛顿，世界第二大经济体及其公司在美国都将面临艰难的处境。【原文：US lawmakers are signaling to China that the world’s second-largest economy and its companies face a tough slog in America for the foreseeable future, regardless of who controls Washington after the November election.】

item.title: 甲骨文支持的芯片制造商 Ampere 探索潜在出售机会
item.description: 据知情人士透露，由拉里-埃里森（Larry Ellison）的甲骨文公司（Oracle Corp.【原文：Ampere Computing LLC, the semiconductor startup backed by Larry Ellison’s Oracle Corp., is exploring a potential sale, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 德国 SEFE 公司希望在私有化前获得更多天然气
item.description: 德国国有天然气公司 SEFE 首席执行官 Egbert Laege 表示，该公司希望在本十年晚些时候私有化之前扩大其供应基地。【原文：German state-owned gas company SEFE is looking to expand its supply base before being privatized later this decade, according to Chief Executive Officer Egbert Laege.】

item.title: 需求疲软迹象抵消美联储降息影响，石油跌势扩大
item.description: 由于美国需求疲软的迹象抵消了美联储大幅降息和中东紧张局势升级的影响，石油连续第二个交易日下滑。【原文：Oil slipped for a second session as signs of weak US demand offset a steep interest rate cut from the Federal Reserve and escalating tensions in the Middle East.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事亚洲
item.description: 早上好。美联储大幅降息。股票和债券摇摇欲坠全世界都在为这一决定的后果做准备。以下是市场动向以下是市场动向。【原文：Good morning. The Fed makes a big rate cut. Stocks and bonds falter. The world braces for the decision’s fallout. Here’s what’s moving markets. Here’s what’s moving markets. — Kristine Aquino】

item.title: 分析师称美联储缩表利好亚洲股市和风险货币
item.description: 分析师表示，美联储将基准利率下调50个基点的决定很可能对亚洲股市构成利好，因为这给了该地区各国央行更多放松政策的空间。【原文：The Federal Reserve’s decision to cut its benchmark interest rate by 50 basis points is likely to be a positive for Asian stocks as it gives the region’s central banks more room to loosen policy, analysts say.】

item.title: 金矿商表示，随着交易的升温，他们现在变得有纪律了
item.description: 随着金价创下历史新高，矿业公司又开始寻求交易，同时试图向投资者保证，他们已经从过去过度消费的错误中吸取了教训。【原文：With gold prices at a record high, mining companies are back hunting for deals while trying to reassure investors that they’ve learned from past mistakes of overspending.】

item.title: 交易商消化美联储决议，股票和债券震荡上行：市场综述
item.description: 美联储周三降息半个百分点后，华尔街股市下跌，亚洲股市也随之出现温和波动。【原文：Asian equities were primed for muted moves following declines on Wall Street after the Federal Reserve’s half-point interest rate cut on Wednesday.】

item.title: 花旗交易员看准美联储降息，却失望而归
item.description: 阿克谢-辛格（Akshay Singal）对美联储周三的降息判断正确并不感到高兴。【原文：Akshay Singal took little pleasure in getting the Federal Reserve’s rate-cut call right on Wednesday.】

item.title: 日本股指期货上涨，日元跌幅收窄，交易商等待日本央行出台政策
item.description: 美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）警告不要假设大规模降息会继续下去，日元因此收窄涨幅，日本股票期货走高。投资者还在等待日本央行周五的决定。【原文：Japanese stock futures edged higher as the yen pared its gains after Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell cautioned against assuming large rate cuts will continue. Investors are also awaiting the Bank of Japan’s decision Friday.】

item.title: 埃隆-马斯克的 X 通过软件更新绕过巴西禁令
item.description: 巴西互联网供应商协会周三表示，埃隆-马斯克的 X 公司通过自动更新软件，成功绕过了巴西对社交媒体网络的禁令。【原文：Elon Musk’s X managed to bypass a ban of the social media network in Brazil though an automatic update of its software, an association of Brazilian internet providers said Wednesday.】

item.title: 帮助雇用 "临时工 "的人工智能初创公司获得维诺德-科斯拉（Vinod Khosla）的支持
item.description: Vahan.ai是一家人工智能驱动的蓝领工人招聘公司，该公司已获得由硅谷亿万富翁维诺德-科斯拉（Vinod Khosla）的科斯拉风险投资公司（Khosla Ventures）领投的1000万美元融资，将人工智能引入了印度长期以来由母婴业者主导的招聘领域。【原文：Vahan.ai, an AI-powered recruiter of blue-collar workers, has secured $10 million in funding led by Silicon Valley billionaire Vinod Khosla’s Khosla Ventures, bringing artificial intelligence to a hiring segment in India long dominated by mom-and-pop operators.】

item.title: S&P 将 80 亿美元的前景基金评级为负面
item.description: S&P Global Ratings 将 Prospect Capital Corp. 的评级展望调整为负面，理由是对其投资组合中不断增加的损失和非应计贷款表示担忧。【原文：S&P Global Ratings revised its outlook on Prospect Capital Corp. to negative, citing concerns over mounting losses and non-accruing loans in its portfolio.】

item.title: 华尔街新纪元开局不顺，美联储埋下隐患
item.description: 杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）的讲话正是华尔街上上下下的交易员们期盼已久的：随着紧缩货币政策时代终于开始逆转，鲍威尔将大幅降息，这将为今年股票和债券的大幅反弹提供理由。【原文：Jerome Powell delivered exactly what traders up and down Wall Street had long hoped for: A big interest-rate cut that would justify this year’s steep rally in stocks and bonds as the era of tight monetary policy finally began to reverse.】

item.title: 被抛弃的债券持有人就重组问题起诉 AMC 娱乐公司
item.description: 一群 AMC Entertainment Holdings Inc. 的票据持有人起诉了这家电影连锁公司，声称 7 月份达成的全面重组协议侵蚀了他们的权利，并优先考虑了更多的次级债券持有人。【原文：A group of AMC Entertainment Holdings Inc.’s noteholders have sued the movie chain company, claiming a sweeping restructuring deal in July eroded their rights and prioritized more junior bondholders.】

item.title: 新西兰猕猴桃银行首席执行官称注资 5 亿新西兰元可启动增长
item.description: 新西兰贷款机构 Kiwibank 首席执行官 Steve Jurkovich 表示，凭借 5 亿新西兰元（约合 3.1 亿美元）的新资本，Kiwibank 将实现大幅增长，并实现政府颠覆银行市场的雄心壮志。【原文：New Zealand lender Kiwibank could grow significantly and achieve the government’s ambitions of disrupting the banking market with NZ$500 million ($310 million) of new capital, Chief Executive Officer Steve Jurkovich said.】
